alert.note: Alert for Allen; Defiance; Fulton; Henry; Paulding; Putnam; Van Wert; Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 26 at 5:37AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...ADDITIONAL HEAVY RAINFALL AND RENEWED RISES IN RIVER LEVELS EXPECTED THIS WEEK... Widespread rain is expected across the area late tonight through Monday afternoon. The current forecast is for 0.75 to 1.25 inches of rainfall during this period. The heaviest rainfall is currently forecasted north of US Route 24, and the period of heaviest rainfall is expected Monday morning. High soil moisture content across the area due to heavy rainfall last week will lead to a large percentage of this additional rainfall to be be runoff. River levels remain elevated and runoff from additional heavy rainfall will lead to renewed rises on area rivers this week. There is still some uncertainty in precipitation amounts on Monday that will impact the extent of additional river rises. In addition to aggravating river flooding across the area, some minor flooding of low lying and flood prone areas is possible, particularly if the higher rainfall amounts in the forecasted range are realized on Monday. Ponding of water on roadways will also be possible on Monday. Persons should monitor later forecasts including the possibility of any flood watches, warnings, and advisories.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Defiance; Fulton; Henry; Paulding; Putnam; Van Wert; Williams
